Title: Implementation of classification technique in web usage mining of banking company
Source title: Proceeding - 2016 International Seminar on Intelligent Technology and Its Application, ISITIA 2016: Recent Trends in Intelligent Computational Technologies for Sustainable Energy
Affiliations: Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Suharjito, Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Diana, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Herianto, Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The goals of this paper is to implement classification technique in web usage mining to a bank company that can help the company to identify web performance issue. Web usage mining consists of three phases: data preprocessing, pattern discovery, and pattern analysis. In pattern discovery phase, we propose to use classification technique with k-nearest neighbor algorithm implemented with standardized Euclidean distance to classifying frequent access pattern. The result shows that the k-nearest neighbor algorithm can be implemented in web usage mining and can help company to find interesting knowledge in web server log. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: classification technique; k-nearest neighbor classification; web usage mining
Index Keywords: Motion compensation; Nearest neighbor search; Pattern recognition; Web crawler; Classification technique; Data preprocessing; Euclidean distance; Frequent access patterns; K nearest neighbor algorithm; K-nearest neighbor classification; Pattern discovery; Web usage mining; Data mining
